newsitem.title: USA: Novell to cut 15 percent of European staff.
newsitem.headline: Novell to cut 15 percent of European staff.

text.p: Novell Inc. confirmed Thursday reports that the software company is cutting its European work force by 15 percent, or about 50 jobs.
"I can confirm that we have announced to our people in Europe a 15 percent reduction in our work force there," said spokesman Jonathan Cohen.
"We are in the process of evaluating our business worldwide, including our work force, but I can't comment any further at this time," Cohen said.
The company, based in Provo, Utah, is expected to post its second-quarter earnings on May 28.
The European reductions were reported in the Wall Street Journal's electronic edition Thursday.

Computer Reseller News, a trade publication, this week cited unidentified sources within Novell as saying that the company will cut its worldwide work force of 5,800 employees by 20 percent. About 1,150 people will be laid off, it said.
Novell's stock edged down 12.5 cents to $7.875 on Nasdaq in late trading.
